sen.j: 秋月 種樹（あきづき たねたつ、天保4年10月17日 (旧暦)（1833年11月28日） - 明治37年（1904年）10月17日）は、幕末・明治期の日本の政治家。
sen.e: Tanetatsu AKIZUKI (November 28, 1833-October 17, 1904) was a Japanese politician at the end of the Edo period and in the Meiji period.
Tanetatsu AKIZUKI (November 28, 1833-October 17, 1904) was a Japanese politician at the end of the Edo period and in the Meiji period.
Tanetatsu AKIZUKI (November 28, 1833-October 17, 1904) was a Japanese politician at the end of the Edo period and in the Meiji period.

sen.j: 日向国高鍋藩の世嗣。
sen.e: He was the heir apparent of the Takanabe Domain (the Akizuki clan) of Hyuga Province.
He was the heir apparent of Takanabe Domain (Akizuki clan) of Hyuga Province.
He was the heir apparent of Takanabe Domain (Akizuki clan) of Hyuga Province.

sen.j: 貴族院議員、参与、明治天皇侍読。
sen.e: He was a member of the House of Peers, Sanyo (Councilor), and Jidoku (Imperial tutor) to Emperor Meiji.
He was a member of the House of Peers, Sanyo (Councilor), and Jidoku (Imperial tutor) to the Emperor Meiji.
He was a member of the House of Peers, Sanyo (Councilor), and Jidoku (Imperial tutor) to the Emperor Meiji.

sen.j: 詩文に優れ、書家としても知られた。
sen.e: He was good at poetry and was also known as a calligrapher.
He was good at poetry and was also known as a calligrapher.
He was good at poetry and was also known as a calligrapher.

sen.j: 雅号は古香。
sen.e: His gago (pseudonym) was 'Koka.'
His gago (pseudonym) was 'Koka.'
His gago (pseudonym) was 'Koka.'

sen.j: 9代高鍋藩主・秋月種任の三男。
sen.e: He was the third son of Tanetada AKIZUKI, the ninth lord of the Takanabe Domain.
He was the third son of Tanetada AKIZUKI, the ninth lord of Takanabe Domain.
He was the third son of Tanetada AKIZUKI, the ninth lord of Takanabe Domain.

sen.j: 正室は烏丸光政の娘。
sen.e: His consort was a daughter of Mitsumasa KARASUMARU.
His consort was a daughter of Mitsumasa KARASUMARU.
His consort was a daughter of Mitsumasa KARASUMARU.

sen.j: 子は秋月種繁（長男）、秋月種英（次男）。
sen.e: His children were Taneshige AKIZUKI (eldest son) and Tanehide AKIZUKI (second son).
His children were Taneshige AKIZUKI (eldest son) and Tanehide AKIZUKI (second son).
His children were Taneshige AKIZUKI (eldest son) and Tanehide AKIZUKI (second son).

sen.j: 文久2年（1862年）、部屋住みの身で幕府学問所奉行に登用される。
sen.e: In 1862, Tanetatsu was assigned to bugyo (Commissioner) of Bakufu Gakumonjo (National College managed directly by bakufu), although his status was still heyazumi (second sons and younger who were in their adolescence and has yet to be independent from the family headed by the eldest son).

In 1862, Tanetatsu was assigned to bugyo (Commissioner) of Bakufu Gakumonjo (National College managed directly by bakufu), although his status was still heyazumi (second sons and younger who were in their adolescence and has yet to be independent from the family headed by the eldest son).

In 1862, Tanetatsu was assigned to bugyo (Commissioner) of Bakufu Gakumonjo (National College managed directly by bakufu), although his status was still heyazumi (second sons and younger who were in their adolescence and has yet to be independent from the family headed by the eldest son).

sen.j: 翌文久3年（1863年）には若年寄格を兼任。
sen.e: In 1863, he also held the post of Wakadoshiyori (executive post for younger generations).
In 1863, he also held the post of Wakadoshiyori (executive post for younger generations).
In 1863, he also held the post of Wakadoshiyori (executive post for younger generations).

sen.j: 秋月家は2万7000石の外様大名であり、異例の抜擢であった。
sen.e: As the Akizuki clan was tozama daimyo (outside feudal lords) with 27,000 koku (fief), this appointment was unprecedented promotion by selection.
As Akizuki clan was tozama daimyo (outside feudal lords) with 27,000 koku (fief), this appointment was unprecedented promotion by selection.
As Akizuki clan was tozama daimyo (outside feudal lords) with 27,000 koku (fief), this appointment was unprecedented promotion by selection.

sen.j: 同年、兄で藩主の秋月種殷の世子となる。
sen.e: In the same year, he became the heir of Tanetomi AKIZUKI, his older brother and the lord of the domain.
In the same year, he became the heir of Tanetomi AKIZUKI, his older brother and the lord of the domain.
In the same year, he became the heir of Tanetomi AKIZUKI, his older brother and the lord of the domain.

sen.j: 元治元年（1864年）、奉行職を辞した。
sen.e: In 1864, he stepped down from Bugyo.
In 1864, he stepped down from Bugyo.
In 1864, he stepped down from Bugyo.

sen.j: 慶応3年（1867年）、若年寄に任ぜられるも出仕せず半年で辞任。
sen.e: In 1867, he was appointed as Wakadoshiyori, but did not attend executive meetings and resigned from the post in a half year.
In 1867, he was appointed as Wakadoshiyori, but did not attend executive meetings and resigned from the post in a half year.
In 1867, he was appointed as Wakadoshiyori, but did not attend executive meetings and resigned from the post in a half year.

sen.j: 維新後に明治政府に出仕。
sen.e: After the Meiji Restoration, he served the Meiji government.
After the Meiji Restoration, he served the Meiji government.
After the Meiji Restoration, he served the Meiji government.

sen.j: 公議所議長・左院少議官・元老院議官・貴族院議員などを歴任した。
sen.e: He held various posts in a row such as the president of Kogisho (the lower house), an executive member of the Council of the Left, a councilor of Genroin (Chamber of Elders), and a member of the House of Peers.

He held various posts in a row such as the president of Kogisho (the lower house), an executive member of the Council of the Left, a councilor of Genroin (Chamber of Elders), and a member of the House of Peers.

He held various posts in a row such as the president of Kogisho (the lower house), an executive member of the Council of the Left, a councilor of Genroin (Chamber of Elders), and a member of the House of Peers.

sen.j: 明治17年（1884年）7月、長男・種繁が男爵を授爵する。
sen.e: In July 1884, his eldest son, Taneshige, was created baron.
In July 1884, his eldest son, Taneshige, was created a baron.
In July 1884, his eldest son, Taneshige, was created a baron.

sen.j: 明治37年（1904年）10月、病のため没する。
sen.e: In 1904, Tanetatsu died from illness.
In 1904, Tanetatsu died from illness.
In 1904, Tanetatsu died from illness.

sen.j: 享年71。
sen.e: He died at the age of 71.
He died at the age of 71.
He died at the age of 71.

sen.j: 従二位勲二等に叙せられる。
sen.e: He was created Junii (Junior Second Rank) Kun Nito (Second Order of Merit).
He was created Junii (Junior Second Rank) Kun Nito (Second Order of Merit).
He was created Junii (Junior Second Rank) Kun Nito (Second Order of Merit).
